content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
!! This review will be deleted after revision is made !!Luxor 5th Passage. The fifth game in the Luxor series. A match-3 marble shooter set on another adventure through Egypt.The main objective is to stop the evil deity Set from taking over the united lands while fighting alongside his nephew Horus. Throughout the game, you must create matches of three or more colored spheres and prevent the scarabs from entering your pyramid. Unlike the other games in the series, this one features Blast Mode and Player's ChoiceMy opinions of it all: To some players of Steam, this review may seem a bit misleading. Recommend watching some gameplay of this game before purchasing. The writer of this review is not responsible for any disappointment upon this game's purchase.The GoodBefore Steam, I used to play simple games such as this one and didn't really complain too much about the repetiton the game had. Another interest was the [Egyptian] mythology that grabbed my attention. Though small, the soundtrack was very fitting, and the power-ups were lovely whenever collected, especially the four new ones exclusive to this very game: Black Hole, Double Shooter, Lead Barrage, Spiker.The BadAt some point in the game as I neared the end, one particular power-up seemed to bug or glitch, malfunction upon collection: Sorter. If the stage was cleared and this was collected, Luxor 5 would instantly crash. Restarting the game, it was obvious that the progress wasn't saved, leaving me to start over. Sorter also didn't exactly work as intended, having all the spheres pushed by the scarab closest to the pyramid vanish from the screen and never reappeared organized by color.OverallThis was, yet, another awesome game in the Luxor series. I managed to complete the game all the way in a few hours, but time doesn't matter all that much to me. Again, this writer is not responsible for any disappointment receive upon the purchase of this very game. You have been warned.--Hermix

content:
Posted: July 20, 2012
												Luxor 5th passage is a Zuma game by Mumbo Jumbo that is a quite enjoyable title.  Fullscreen mode is supported, although the screen is stretched from a fairly low resolution window, but unfortunately the Steam Overlay is not supported.  The game features a wide variety of detailed scenario backdrops and ball paths, as well as a nice selection of power ups, extra point gems and coins and end level achievement trophies that are in game only. Altogether this is one of the better casual puzzle games on the market and I would recommend it to anyone interested in a solid casual challenge.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Just one big reason why I have to NOT recommend this game.The screen resolution.800 x 600 ONLY!!What the hell do they think we use for monitors here in the 21st century?? Even when I had old CRT monitors I would of been ticked off with this game! But to sell a game in this resolution is a joke. As far as I know, there is nothing that you can do regarding some sort of widescreen hack etc, like you can with some older games.The game itself, playablity wise, MAY be okay. But to be honest, I just can't bring myself to play Luxor with oval shaped stretched balls coming down the screen.Just glad I didn't pay much for this one. :(

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Get ready to wield your winged-scarab shooter in an all-new LUXOR, the #1 action-puzzle game of all time!Navigate your shooter to ensure matches of three or more—fire colored balls into the advancing chain of colored spheres to eliminate them before they destroy the pyramids. Unlock all 20 achievements as you collect Ankh coins for extra lives and catch falling treasures for big bonus points.Save ancient Egypt in the 100-level Adventure mode, or test your accuracy in all-new Blast mode—the 2-minute timed mode that challenges you to rack up the points. Or play through People’s Choice mode, where we give you 15 of players’ favorites levels from LUXOR 2, LUXOR 3 and Quest for the Afterlife!Master four new power-ups: the powerful Double Shooter, the devastating Black Hole, the ruinous Spiker Ball, and the deathly Lead Barrage. Outfitted with 25 all-new backgrounds and pathways, LUXOR Fifth Passage also introduces the Eye of Horus—click the button when you’re in a real jam to eliminate all remaining spheres. And, for the true LUXOR Pharaoh, an Insane difficulty level to test your marble-shooting skills! Celebrate 5 years of LUXOR’s reign in the 5th Passage!

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
												Don't get me wrong with the negative review, this game is very good. Fun power ups, easy to learn, good gameplay.However, theres issues with the game that makes it unplayable. Sometimes I encounter a bug that renders the shooter unable to make the balls hit the target. I can shoot anywhere, it never registers. The resolution on the game is also painfully small for someone with a wide screen. 800 texture on a 1900 monitor just doesn't work and playing it in windowed mode makes the game screen too tiny.
